modules.name: jxcore_command_help
modules.desc:
Executing jx binary with --help option displays list of possible commands. 

> jx --help

modules.name: usage
modules.desc:
jx [options] [ -e script | script.js ] [arguments]
jx debug script.js [arguments]

modules.name: options
modules.desc:
Many of the options are thoroughly documented in separate sections of the documentation:

  • compile - compile jx file from jxp project
  • install - installs a module from the repository
  • mt - multithread the given application (no-keep)
  • mt-keep - multithread the given application (keep alive)
  • package - create jxp project from the folder (recursive)

Other options are:

  • -jxv, --jxversion - print jxcore's version
  • -v, --version - print corresponding node's version
  • -e, --eval - script evaluate script
  • -p, --print - evaluate script and print result
  • -i, --interactive - always enter the REPL even if stdin does not appear to be a terminal
  • --no-deprecation - silence deprecation warnings
  • --trace-deprecation - show stack traces on deprecations
  • --v8-options - print v8 command line options
  • --max-stack-size=val - set max v8 stack size (bytes)
